item.title: Combining Jupyter and Hugo
item.description: Here, I briefly present my workflow to convert Jupyter notebooks to Hugo articles. Setup pip install jupyter nbconvert Convert Notebook to Markdown jupyter nbconvert --to markdown notebook.ipynb You will end up with the markdown file notebook.md and a directory containing the notebook’s assets called notebook_files. Create new Hugo Post To keep the notebook’s main text and its assets together I decided to not put the assets into Hugo’s /static directory. Instead we create a new folder in /content/ (or wherever the post should appear) and give it the name of our post.
